Identify the rarest adverb in the following sentence.
After the storm, the wind howled fiercely through the desolate valley.

In the sentence "After the storm, the wind howled fiercely through the desolate valley," the adverb is "fiercely." Given the context of this sentence, "fiercely" can be considered the rarest adverb because it conveys a more intense and vivid description of the manner in which the wind howled, compared to common adverbs like "quickly" or "slowly." This intensity and specificity can make it less commonly used in everyday language, thus potentially making it the "rarest" adverb in this context.
